inn1.comm: over the wicket, fired in full and blocked back towards the bowler

bowled him, straight through the defences! Irfan strikes second ball, sending Roy back to the hutch... Played with a slightly crooked bat, looking to force a length ball towards mid-on, there was a touch of seam movement back in and it burst the stumps after flicking the front pad
pitched up and punched into the off side coming forwards
slightly back of a length, Root drops back and dabs in front of square
woof, that's a steepler, flying through from slightly back of a length as Root chases it outside off
tighter line, defended into the covers
over the wicket, pitched up on off stump and Hales larrups it straight back past the bowler to get going first ball
strays on to the pads this time and Hales clips three through backward square, Irfan lumbering round the boundary to stick a boot in the way
pushed into the covers coming forwards
full outside the line of off, punched back towards mid-off

rapped on the pads, the ball nipping back past inside edge... and given! Root decides to review after a brief word with Hales but this looked pretty adjacent, he was stuck on the crease and hit around the knee roll, looked like it would have juddered leg stump. Here comes Hawk-Eye... Yes, hitting the top of leg on umpire's call and Root heads off for a seven-ball duck having wasted England's one review
angled across the left-hander in the channel, lets it go
lets this one go outside off
plays off the back foot and edges but the ball stays very low, bounces short of Sarfraz
gets across and defends around off stump
full on the pads, 88mph and timed sweetly through midwicket, though it holds up in the outfield
fullish on middle and off, Morgan pats it back down the track
here come the short ball, testing Morgan's mettle... and it flies over Sarfraz and away! Morgan went for the pull, think it came off his forearm and just about cleared the keeper
swishes outside off, nicked and taken at slip! Younis juggles the chance but holds on, to then be mobbed by his team-mates. The old magic hasn't quite faded and England are three down for spit
sliding on to the pads, flicked away through backward square for one
good length, in the channel outside off, Morgan happy to leave
length delivery, 80mph and slightly too close to cut, bottom-edged towards point
not all that short, not all that wide but it's slashed punishingly through cover point for a boundary to Morgan
tighter line, pushed towards mid-off
pitched up around the line of off, punched back down the track
back of a length, dabbed down into the covers
fullish, comes forward and defends
tight line from Irfan, 87mph on the stumps, Taylor gets on top of it again
slightly overpitched and Taylor rifles it back through mid-on... Well, almost through mid-on but Bilal makes an excellent diving stop to prevent any runs
pushed back down the track
slanted across, Morgan drops back outside off and chops behind point
off-stump line, Taylor dabs it softly back towards the bowler
angled in and worked back towards mid-on
comes forward to a length ball and pokes it back to the bowler
shuffles across and whips the ball wristily through midwicket, lovely timing and the ball races away out of the middle - Taylor's first boundary
length ball around off stump, turned short into the leg side
bangs in the short ball, plenty of bounce but there's not quite the pace in the pitch to trouble Morgan and he's up on his tippy-toes to swat through backward point for a couple wide of fine leg
length ball, clipped off the pads through midwicket
slightly back of a length, Taylor takes his bottom hand of the bat as he defends in the crease
length delivery, 87mph and tailing away outside off, Taylor leaves it be

gadzooks, that's not come out right! Almost a beamer at wee Titch Taylor (so a low full toss to most batsmen), outside off and he swung and missed, not called a no-ball, either, though it looked above waist height
length ball, shuffles into line and defends
tight lines from Anwar, pushed back down the track
oh, nearly flicked to midwicket! Morgan manufactured a shovel off his pads and it was just out of reach of the flying fielder
length ball, tucked into the leg side
on the stumps, pushed towards mid-off
Morgan comes forward and drives gently towards mid-off
slower ball, on the pads and dinked through backward square for one
round the wicket, straightening on off stump, keeps a little low and Morgan blocks
gives this a bit more air, drifting on to the pads and it's swept confidently past backward square for four
angled in on the stumps, tapped back toward the bowler
tossed up, pushed into the covers
comes forward and punches this into a gap wide of mid-off for one
over the wicket to Taylor, tossed up and he scampers out, hits it straight to midwicket
sound the alarm! Morgan dances out and lofts Anwar over mid-on, one-bounce four! Proactive stuff and sweetly struck
length ball, around off stump, chopped into the turf
good length just outside off, Morgan dabs it into the covers
length ball outside off and driven on the up through the overs for four more. Morgan is oozing class here
switches to round the wicket, 80mph in the channel, Morgan inside-edges between his legs trying to force through the off side
back over the wicket, turned to leg from around off stump
floated up outside off, reaches forward and drives to the cover sweeper
skips out and pushes one more to long-on
tossed up around off stump, Morgan dabs to short extra cover
flighted, comes forward, drives another single back past the bowler to long-off
cheeky from Taylor, down on one knee and he scoops one over Sarfraz's outstretched left arm for a couple to fine leg - that's the 50 up for England
flighted, comes forward on off stump, clips one to long-on
length, spinning away outside off, drops back and chops a couple through backward point
tossed up, comes forward and drills one more to long-on
flighted, on the stumps, Morgan chops it into the ground towards backward point
drops back and pokes the ball square
gives it some air, Taylor gets out to the pitch and punches another single down the ground
gives it a rip, Morgan presses forward to defend on off stump
pushed back to the bowler, Taylor hurriedly regains his ground
floated up, Taylor's down early to again ramp the ball over the keeper for a couple more
skips forward and punches a single towards long-on
round the wicket, popped on a length, blocked back to the bowler
Morgan leans out and pushes to the off side, Malik fields off his own bowling
angled in, worked against the spin into a gap at midwicket

superbly done from Morgan, looking a millions dirhams today, reverses the hands to swat four past backward point - that raises the 50 stand between these two, doing a good job of righting England's ship
flighted, around the line of off, Morgan gets forward this time and drives into a gap at wide long-off for three
angled in on the stumps, worked back towards mid-on, who's a little deep and they take one
on the stumps, can't get this one away
flighted, pushed into the off side
tossed up, Morgan works it back into the on side and Yasir fields
presses forward and defends back to the bowler
worked into a gap on the leg side for one
tossed up, Morgan plays across the line towards midwicket
drops back and in the crease and clips the ball off his legs through square
angled in from round the wicket, pushed defensively into the off side
fractionally short and slapped through backward point, played very late and struck firmly past the fielder to pick up four more
good length on off stump. Punched firmly down the ground and a hustled quick single as mid-off slides to gather
guided into the covers, on the back foot, forcing the gaps
lovely ball, ghosting past a flat-footed prod as Morgan tries to run a single to third man
this time he succeeds in his aim, an open-faced steer safely through the vacant cordon
on the toes, clipped to backward square
shuffles into line to defend
sharp turn from middle to leg, clipped to midwicket and a direct hit would have been tight!
hanging on the back foot, slow turn and angled to point
Morgan stands tall on the back foot again, pushed to cover
chopped out to point again, a bit of a pattern
cut hard, a bit of bounce on off stump, down to third man
short, slapped, lovely. The captain shows that that blow on the head has not upset his impressive run of form. Another half-century, his eighth fifty in 11 ODIs
outside off, a wafty cut, no connection
on the toes, clipped to square leg
on the hip, tucked around the corner
squared up a touch by some extra lift
short and an attempted pull, no connection, good heat from Wahab, as you would expect ...
on the back foot, pushed to mid-on. Just the single in a hostile over
outside off, down the track, whisked into the leg side
low full toss, poked back to the bowler, who gathers on the bounce as Taylor dives back into his crease as a precaution
forward and defended down the track
a bit of length to work with, played very late, chopped backward of point. Lovely gap-finding
forward and sniffing the leather in defence
dead-batted to complete the over
forward and defended
driven sweetly, a touch wide, on the up, with a follow-through that walloped then wobbled like a trapdoor being released on a spring. Fetch that
forward and pushed out to cover
worked into the gap
swept
defended urgently on the back foot
forward and blocked down the track, with a closed face, always working the angles
round the wicket, tossed up, slapped into the deep, one bounce and gathered
over the wicket this time, lots of width and chopped out to third man
tossed right up to the toes, driven firmly with a waft of the blade
down the track, defended on the move, half an appeal but nothing doing
finds the gap this time and Taylor pierces the cover ring with another sweetly timed drive. Excellent intent from this pair
defended off the back foot
pushed onto the back foot, solid defence
solidly into line again
slower ball, deflected out to gully
short, attempted pull but not timed
forward and defended
hops across the crease to work a single into the covers
deep in the crease, angled bat, nothing doing
on the hip, flicked to backward square
not sure how that ended up in the covers, but Taylor's attempted leg-glance takes a comfortable leading edge through point
short, and easily pulled through midwicket. No pace whatsoever off the surface. Sounds familiar ...
fenced out to gully, a bit of extra life from a fuller length. That's the benefit of bowling from the cloud-line
crunched out to midwicket rope
defended on the back foot
defended with a measured drive back to the bowler
sharp turn but short enough to watch onto the bat, defended to square leg
forward and blocked back to the bowler, a couple of paces to meet the pitch
twirled onto the toes, clipped to the bowler. Tidy over
half a step down the track and thwacked to the leg side, as if swatting the WASP itself
slower ball, Morgan seemed to pick it, but he couldn't time his ugly smear through cow corner. Through to the keeper
beaten more conventionally this time, extra pace
down the leg side
better line, Morgan can't make capital
shorter, Morgan wafts into a pull, but can't connect once again
another leg-side anomaly
yorker, well dug out ...
on the toes, Taylor was already walking into the stroke so an easy single to midwicket
tossed onto a good length
walloped down the ground, it hangs in the air for a time but drops short of long-on
short, Taylor attempts a helicopter pull through midwicket but can't make proper contact
down the track, a closed-faced drive to midwicket
short and an attempted pull, under-edged out to midwicket
too short, smashed through midwicket. That was emphatic
on the back foot, eased into the gully region
clipped to midwicket, good swift calling
down the track, sumptuous footwork and that is a towering straight six! The first of the match and worth the wait.
on the hip, tapped through square leg
crunched into the covers, a promising over from England's perspective
defended from the crease
into position early for the sweep, flicked fine, well placed
on the back foot, driven to cover
driven back to the bowler
outside off, cut firmly through the covers
forward and defended
down the track, turns into the pads
slap-a-doodle-do! Taylor brings up his fifty with a monstrous uppercut of a straight six, under the ball, full swing, fetch me another
down on one knee, urgently swept to square leg
worked into the gap
blocked
another productive over from England's perspective
outside off, attempted cut, through to the keeper with an ooh and an aah
punched into the covers
on the pads, flicked to square leg
blocked into the leg-side
driven down the ground
worked into the gap to keep the strike
defended
dropped! A towering slogged wipe into the leg-side, hung in the air for yonks but, actually, the fielder in the covers didn't actually get a finger on it. He probably should have done
a wicket this time! Full length, a firm drive, a hint of spin, a thin edge, an easy take. A fine innings comes to an end
back into the crease, defended
down on one knee, swept through square leg

round the wicket, tip and run, it's a suicide single to midwicket and even without a direct hit, there's plenty time for the keeper to whip off the bails! Dreadful cock-up in the calling and Buttler's desperate tour takes another nosedive
clunked into the covers
a yelp of excitement as cover fields again
poked out to point, joining the dots
on the toes, a straight-faced drive to long-on
on the pads, turning down the leg-side and helped on its way
defended back down the pitch
round the wicket, forward and defended
on the pads, flicked through midwicket
forward and defended
big stride, big appeal. And they are reviewing. Actually, no they aren't, they are out of time ...! I thought that pitched outside leg, personally: EDIT ... no it wasn't ...
flicked through midwicket
dead-batted to point, and a scampered single
flighted, on leg stump, clipped to the fielder square
Moeen skips out and chips over the man at extra cover, just enough on it and it bounces safely
goes down early and attempts to paddle fine, keeper and slip go chasing to the leg side... but the ball got stuck under the bat and didn't go anywhere
fizzed through around off stump, opens the face and runs one behind point
runs down the pitch and drives one more to long-off
blocked into the covers, there's a misfield but they'll not get a run off it

skips out and chips the ball to midwicket! Taylor is gone now, England getting back to basics with a collapse against spin... He was playing with the turn, didn't get to the pitch and it looped in front of Azhar, who threw himself forward low to his left and held on smartly
angled in from round the wicket, played back to the bowler
touch short, played from the crease, gets an inside edge into a gap on the leg side
pushed through on the stumps, Moeen languidly taps it away into the off side
floated up and worked back through mid-on for one
flat trajectory, outside the line of off, Woakes punches it past extra cover to long-off
pushed through on off stump, punched back
gives it a bit more air, Woakes strokes towards one of the blokes in the covers
closes the face slightly, a leading edge pops back towards Yasir but runs away through mid-on for one

plucked out of thin air, Moeen is gone! Brilliant from Babar Azam, leaping to his left with Velcro (TM) fingers and holding a screamer one-handed! Moeen rocked back to pull a short delivery, hit it out of the screws but somehow it has brought Yasir his first wicket
tossed up, driven through the covers to the man in the deep
Woakes finishes the over with a boundary, full toss from Yasir and it's crunched through midwicket into a gap
tossed up and flicked through backward square from the crease
clipped off the pads through long-on coming forwards
flatter, Rashid nudges it to square leg
waits in the crease, on the pads and worked fine for one more
on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
flatter, Woakes goes back in the crease and blocks
pitched up in the channel outside off, Rashid steers a drive through backward point
short of a length, Woakes defends down in front of square
stays back and blocks around off stump
length delivery on the pads, Woakes closes the face and nudges one through midwicket
fullish, outside off, opens the face and runs one more behind square on the off side
angled on middle and leg stump from round the wicket, nudged off the pads
drops back and flicks one through backward square
tossed up, Woakes gets down on one knee and lap-sweeps one more to short fine leg
defended into the off side coming forwards
tossed up on the stumps, Rashid turns it to midwicket
flighted, tries to flick one to long-on, Malik moves across and cuts it off
back of a length, Woakes reaches away from his body and pokes into the off side
oof, hit in the bread basket trying to pull! Wahab banged the ball in, might have got a slight bottom edge, then took it in the gut
goes round the wicket, length in the channel, swings and misses
tighter line, defended into the off side
good length outside off, Woakes taps it towards backward point
fired leg side-ish, hits the padding and Wahab appeals, Sarfraz too but the umpire isn't interested and the ball skedaddles away to fine leg for valuable extras
pitched up in the channel, Rashid steers another drive behind square
short of a length, Woakes runs it down to third man

full on the stumps, Rashid brings out his helicopter shot... and plinks it straight to mid-on! More like Budgie the Little Helicopter, that, whipped wristily back down the ground, a la MS Dhoni but without quite the same effect
stays over the wicket, defends a shortish ball on off stump
full and straight, clipped through backward square leg to get off the mark
lovely bowling from Irfan, dupes Woakes with a cutter that narrowly fails to clip the top of off!
good length outside off, Willey lets it go
pitched up and punched into the covers half forward

speared in at the toes, a late-swinging yorker from Wahab and Willey only just manages to jam his bat down in time! Wahab was appealing for lbw but there was no pad involved, the ball squeezed between his legs and they pinched a run
round the wicket, slower ball, I think, Woakes hit the pad swinging to leg, missing the stumps with the angle
gets across to defend around the line of off
short ball, Willey takes a blow on the ribs! He's down! That was short, fast and nasty - he's going to need some treatment here
on the stumps, pushed back down the ground
gets across to defend a length ball around off stump
slung down the leg side, Willey flicks and misses, despite an appeal from Sarfraz
speared in at the pads, doesn't get any bat on it again, missing leg
short, rolls his fingers over the ball, Willey is early on a pull and bottom-edges one to fine leg
back of a length outside off, Woakes opens the face and runs it to third man
pitched full and straight, aims a drive down the ground and gets a thick inside edge through backward square
tossed up on the legs, Willey chops it through midwicket
length ball, straightening on middle and off, Woakes defends solidly
pushed through, drops back and stabs one through cover point out towards the sweeper
sliding on outside off, not much turn and it beats the outside edge
clipped off the legs through square for one more
tossed up, Woakes defends and Yasir ends with solid figures of 1 for 38 from his 10
fired in on the stumps, Willey squeezes it out via and inside edge
Woakes waits in the crease and steers wide of third man for a couple more
follows the ball outside off and is beaten, not full enough to drive
full on middle stump, Woakes drives off the inside half of the bat and gets it past mid-on
short outside off, cracked to deep point off the back foot
slips in the yorker, maybe a slower ball, Willey shuts the door on it and they steal another single
slightly short outside off, pushed square into a gap
short outside off, Woakes defends it down behind square, the point fielder fails to collect and they come back for two - 200 up for England
short ball, Woakes flinches underneath it
punched into the covers, straight to the fiedler and Woakes was well out of the frame as the throw came in... but it missed
digs out another yorker, Willey calls Woakes through and Wahab kicks the ball into the stumps, nearly rolled his ankle in the process
on the stumps, flicked through backward square, in the air but into a gap
length ball on leg stump, glanced square
tight lines from Anwar, on the stumps and worked to mid-on
drops short, possibly a slower-ball bouncer, Woakes reaches up to help it through square leg
sends down a cutter and Willey has a big ole yahoo, misses it by a distance
length ball outside off, swatted into the covers - Anwar collecting dots like Pacman
swings across the line and gets a bottom edge into the ground, back towards the bowler, who leaps to field

full and fast, Woakes squeezes down on it and Sarfraz takes an excellent low catch... He's asking the question but was it a bump ball? Yes, yes it was. Would have obliterated off stump if he hadn't got the toe of the bat on it
short ball this time, Woakes swings himself out of the way, blindly hoping to connect
low full toss from Wahab, wide of the stumps, might have been an outside edge before it bounced through to the keeper
pitched up, Woakes digs it out towards long-on and they come charging back to two
rolls his fingers over the ball, Woakes can't get it through the off side
back of a length, smeared through the covers, an excellent bit of fielding keeps them to one
backs away and slices one through backward point
pitched up and Willey swings the arms, gets a couple through backward point
he swings, he misses... Irfan hits! Off stump rattled and England lose their ninth wicket after a steady Eddy 33-run stand. Third wicket for Irfan
gets in line to defend his stumps
another cutter from Irfan, bounces over the stumps! He's just too darn tall... Topley playing down the wrong line
back of a length, Topley stays inside it and lets the ball fly through
full toss from Wahab, swing and a miss from the batsman
goes full again, this time Woakes manages to slap it away through point, cut off in the deep
another full bunger from Wahab, driven to the sweeper in the covers for one

Topley misses again, they run to the keeper... and Sarfraz's direct hit removes Woakes! Superbly done, underarming the ball straight back where it came from and leaving Woakes short of his ground by a frame. So England are dismissed for 216 with two balls left unbowled

inn2.comm: a hint of swing, but straight into the middle of a sweetly timed leg clip. A racing start!
full length, attacking the blockhole, and duly blocked
worked with the swing, out to Ali at square leg
definite signs of swing, more of an off-stump line now and deflected with a bit of unease to square leg
forward and driven through the covers. It don't need a thing if you ain't got the right length for your swing ...
better line and length, a solid block to finish a leaky over
swing, but wide and heading wider
swing, and a much tighter line, much better, a genuine edge and Joe Root at slip can't quite get his fingers under a half-volley of a chance!
down the leg side. That one did not swing ...
bending back into the right-hander, defended with a squeeze of bat and pad, and half an appeal, but a clear inside-edge, outside the line. Good ball
hmmm ... down the leg-side again. It's like watching Harmison at Old Trafford 2007 ...
much better, banged onto a good length, left alone on line, tight to off stump
outside off again, wider line, and through to the keeper
bending back in, very full, very straight, and that is plumb! Remarkable scenes. Three wides, an edge, an inside-edge, and now a wicket!
outside off, joins the dots nicely. Well, it is all happening
outside off, holding its line across the right-hander. Through to the keeper
good line again, lifting a touch off the deck. Through to the keeper
variable bounce ... England won't mind that, as another off-stump delivery scuttles through to the keeper
width, and glided down to third man
much better line in this over
up on the toes, on the back foot, punched calmly into the gap in the covers
outside off, Buttler gathers
massive appeal as Topley straightens another one into the pads! And England will review. Looks mighty straight, but it was a big stride, might be a height issue? Nope, he's a goner!
another appeal, another inducker to the right-hander ... dicey times
this one holds its line, width and a swish

very wide, would have been called as such if Younis had left it alone, but instead he toe-ends a wipe for four through long-off. The most village passage of play of the tour ... completed by Eoin Morgan running through treacle and tumbling in a heap into the boundary rope ...
better ball, fuller length, Younis can't time his drive.
fuller length, defended. Weirdness going on with the sightscreens. Delays all over the shop
on the pads, whipped fine. Can't bowl there, lad. As his Headingley fans will be telling him next term.
driven into the covers and that's a stunning diving stop by Taylor, who relays to his colleague at point in a single movement
full, targeting the base of the stumps
slower ball, Hafeez loiters in his crease and clips to square leg
tight line, defended
slower ball, on off stump, inside-edged defence, the movement is subtle but significant
punched on the back foot to cover
lovely strike, full face, flowing bat. Through long-off
a touch wider, can't time a back-foot drive
width, and driven back to the bowler
full length, pushed into the covers
beautiful strike, stands tall on the back foot, and it is as if the act of standing tall is sufficient to impart all of the pace and timing required for a perfect straight boundary
a touch wider, defended
on leg stump, short midwicket tidies up
on the pads, pushed to cover
shuffles into line to defend on the back foot
another over dotted up
crunched into the covers, Hales fields, with a crunch. That stung
onto the front foot, driven again
width, cut into the covers
on the pads, tucked to short fine leg
Hafeez returns the strike
outside off, another decent over notched up
sumptuous timing, good stride, flowing blade. Straight as straight can be for the new bowler
defended into the off-side
yorker! And a massive appeal! That would have been tight if there's no bat involved ...They are reviewing. But, there's more bat involved than in a darkened cave. On we go
another attempted yorker but too full this time, Hafeez whisks through square leg
short but straight, crunched to cover point
defended
onto the back foot, defended to cover
sharp call of no, and just as well, pushed into the covers
solid forward defence, good full length, but climbing into the bat
defended
pulled, straight to mid-on, and Younis Khan's ODI career is over! Adil Rashid completes a low catch with a tumble and England have an opening
good length, defended. Interesting times...
outside off, clunked to point
blocked on the back foot
poked away again, no swing but a tidy line
too short, and Hafeez latches onto that with a tremendous pull, fizzes off the bat and through the gap. He is in some form
forward and poked to cover
forward and defended. Pakistan faced with a spot of regrouping action ...
forward and defended
a clipped single to the leg side
yes, no, maybe ... Hafeez's call nearly leads to another run-out! He is in some form, but he is still a liability...
less drama this time
slower ball, on the pads, clipped to fine leg
outside off, climbing through to the keeper
forward and defended to cover
clipped to midwicket and a quick call. Which is an achievement in itself
worked with an angled bat to midwicket
another single, and up comes Pakistan's fifty
milking the bowling a touch now, picks the gap with a beautiful back-foot drive
forward and defended, and I think it's time for some spin
too short, and slapped up and over the leg side. Rashid is too slow to err on length, and he pays the price
wider and flatter, fenced through point
short again, slammed out to cow corner, and Hales is ten yards in from the boundary! He'd have swallowed that if he was on the rope!
driven through the off side, runs leaking now ...
tossed up, might have been the googly, but calmly pushed to cover
sharp turn but too easy to loiter on the back foot and watch it into the middle of the bat. Cut into the covers for an expensive over
driven into the covers
a touch of width, eased down to third man
wider on the crease, Stuart Broad-style, speared into the toes
open face, steered down to third man
full length, measured drive to mid-on
bouncer. Well bowled, well ducked
flighted, gets this to dip and bounce (always a good start), pushed into the covers for one
tossed up on the stumps, worked to leg
Malik gets forward and punches ODI run number 6001 through the off side
tossed up on leg stump, squeezed behind square
gives it some air, Malik gets a stride in and drives to mid-off
pushed through, tapped back to the fielder at mid-off again - much quieter second over from Rashid
floated up on the stumps, Hafeez tries to paddle it fine and Buttler moves across in anticipation, the ball actually runs behind him and Malik had come halfway down before being sent back
comes forward and works one down the ground
tossed up, spinning in and turned short into the leg side
clipped to the man at midwicket
flat on the stumps and Malik again finds the fielder at midwicket
tight lines from Moeen, played with the turn back to the on side
tossed up and pushed through the covers coming forwards
poorly fielded down at deep backward point and Hafeez gets four, played the late cut well but should have been cut off
Hafeez is done by the googly again, as he was in the Sharjah Test, just manages to get his bat down in front of the stumps, fractionally before the ball thumped into his back leg
comes forward and pushes into the off side
tossed up, Malik uses his pad and the ball loops safely into a vacant spot
drops a little short, Hafeez swivels and pulls on out to deep midwicket
angled in on the stumps, clipped through midwicket
tossed up outside off, pushed wide of cover
drops back and cuts, Taylor doesn't field it cleanly but is quickly up and after it to prevent a run
taken on the full through the leg side
Malik skips out and hoicks the ball into the leg side, looked a little risky but he got it between deep midwicket and long-on and it bounces to the rope
outside off, driven into the covers
tossed up high on off stump, reaches out and punch fine of mid-off for one
gives it some air, driven square along the carpet

Rashid drops in the googly and this time Hafeez doesn't have any problems, picks it up and crunches the ball into the fence in front of the grass banks at deep midwicket - raises the bat for his fifty
slightly wide, steered between point and short third man for one more
floated up around off stump, Malik drills it to long-off
pushed through flat on middle and off, Malik flicks it into a gap at deep square leg for two
spinning down the leg side, Malik lets it go
clipped off the pads through midwicket
angled in and turned to leg, can't get this through the infield
tossed up, Hafeez is down early, sweeps with the vigour of Dick van Dyke in Mary Poppins and gets four through square leg
shuffles across and flicks one behind square on the leg side
pushed through flat outside off, defended on the back foot
flat around off stump, pushed square
gives this some air, down the leg side and then spinning, beats Hafeez's sweep to strike the pads. Well bowled
comes forward and pushes back to the bowler
more spin and bounce for Rashid, the batsman pulls out of an attempted cut
flighted, comes forward and drives through the covers
pushed through, stays a little low and there's an "ooh" from the bowler as Malik jabs it away
punched back down the track, Moeen dives across to grab it
tossed up and worked behind square on the leg side, Morgan hares after it and prevents a single
tossed up and flicked in the air behind backward square leg, Hafeez paddling across the line
steps out and blocks back to the bowler
pushed through outside the line of off, Malik waits on it and then cocks his wrists at the last moment to glide past the keeper
shuffles across and punches square through the off side out to the sweeper
flighted, gets forward, drives to mid-off
tossed up, punched into the off side
gets on to the front foot but again can't get it past mid-off
tight lines, on middle and off, Hafeez pokes it away into a gap in the covers for one
drops short and Malik finishes the over with a boundary, roundhousing a pull out towards wide long-on
on the stumps, clipped behind square

drops back and flips into the leg side... taken! Silence around the ground as Malik begins to wander off, realising he has tossed away his wicket there. Might have just stopped in the surface a touch, hit it in the air and Roy walked in to accept the gift
length ball on the stumps, drops back and nudges behind square
on the stumps, patted away
overpitched outside off, Hafeez creams a drive through the covers
pushed into the covers coming forwards
flat legbreak in the channel outside off, left alone
on the stumps, worked short to the on side
gives it some air, dipping on middle and leg, smother it on the front foot
gets on to the front foot and pushes into the covers
gets a bit of turn and bounce and hits the splice
picks the gap this time and strokes one out towards deep cover
big lbw appeal from Moeen, turning the ball past the inside edge into the front pad... Maybe outside the line?
worked to the leg side
presses forward, dabs short into the covers
slightly short from Moeen, drops back and chops a single to long-on
tossed up around off stump and beautifully played, minimal backlift and just stroked through the covers for four
goes round the wicket, Hafeez flicks it towards mid-on
drops short, spinning away outside off, Azam cuts in front of square
pitching on off stump, Hafeez makes room to steer through point to the man in the deep
Rashid gives it some air, Azam gets out and bunts one down the ground to long-off
Hafeez aims a woolly woof down the ground and is beaten by the turn, as is Buttler and the ball runs away for byes
pushed into a gap on the off side
tossed up, the googly, Azam picks it and smites six over long-on! His first in international cricket
pushed through, Hafeez dabs into the covers
on the stumps, turned to leg
good length, Hafeez gets down early and sweeps fine for one
on the stumps, clipped towards midwicket
flighted, outside off, punched into the covers
tossed up, Azam uses the feet and drills back past the bowler, who misses it in his follow through
shortish, stays back in the crease and runs the ball to third man
over the wicket, angled across the right-hander, glided to third man for one more
drops short and Azam can't get his cut past backward point
goes round the wicket, pitched up and thumped through the covers
goes back and steers the ball towards point
good length, blocked into the covers
on the pads, Azam waits in the crease and nudges it fine
tossed up and swept through backward square
Root dobs the ball on leg stump, flicked off the pads for one more
low full toss, Hafeez sweeps but sends it straight to square leg
outside leg stump, Hafeez gets down to sweep, picks up a couple to fine leg... Or rather just the one, with the umpires calling a short run
tossed up and clipped through midwicket for one more
on the pads, flicked fine and gathered with a tumble ...
down the leg side, massive appeal, England are sure there was bat but the umpire thinks pad ... and the pad was nowhere near! No reviews for England ...
insult to injury, a fierce thump into the covers
round the wicket, defended back down the wicket
pushed into the covers
straightening on leg stump, defended awkwardly from the crease
round the wicket, worked to square leg
milked for another single to square leg
on the pads, clipped to midwicket, a loud cry of no. Quite right too
round the wicket, defended to midwicket again
again, clipped to leg. It's the only way to go
down the track, smashed through the covers, nope, worked to leg again
half an appeal but Hafeez was well back on his stumps and that was going down leg
down the track, clipped to midwicket
round the wicket, tight restrictive line
worked to leg once again
slower ball, crunched into the covers
yorker length, drilled up to mid-on
round the wicket, Hafeez sweeps and a big appeal! Leg byes are given so there's no bat involved, but it looks to have pitched outside the line
driven down to long-off
clipped to midwicket
down the leg-side, too easy to deflect it round the corner
worked to leg again. Obviously
defended back down the pitch and that will be drinks
outside off, driven out to point
outside off, pushed to cover
back of a length, slapped back at Woakes' ankles, who fields in his followthrough
drilled into the covers
width, and cut sharply to point but half-fielded with a dive
stands tall in defence, decent over
defended out to midwicket, round the wicket
tight line from round the wicket again, blocked on the back foot
worked into the covers
on the pads, flicked around the corner, using the angle that the round-the-wicket line already created. Easy pickings
too short, flogged on the up over cow corner, and now Pakistan are cooking!
speared into the toes but worked fine, good running
good delivery, but there's no slip at this late stage! Angled in, straightened off the pitch, genuine edge, Buttler had no chance
short, and pulled through square leg
fuller length, driven to short midwicket
worked through the leg side again
stands tall in defence, pushed to cover, Hales fields with a tumble
fuller length, attempted yorker, squeezes past bat and stumps
on the back foot, punched into the covers
worked off the hip to square leg
driven hard down the ground
outside off, cut through point, a languid lean of a stroke
very full, and clonked over the bowler's head, a half-hearted shot, but effective
chipped in the air, inches short of Morgan, diving in at short midwicket! A misread offcutter, and nearly the breakthrough
outside off, room to free the arms, and clumped into the covers
defended on the back foot
back-foot cut to cover
on the pads, looked a touch quicker and Hafeez was unable to nurdle it away
solid stride forward and drilled to cover
deflected into the gully off the back foot, good quick calling
bosh. Goodnight. Straight down the ground
pushed into the covers
on the toes, flicked to midwicket
defended on the back foot
defended once again, into space. Hafeez will not be hurried to three figures
on the back foot, worked back to the bowler who feigns a shy
outside off, worked through the covers
full length, a bottom-handed drive but can't connect properly
battered, on the up, over the ropes, and Babar picks the slower ball, out of the back of the hand, to club his way to a half century!
driven from deep in the crease
forward, poked into the covers
pushed to cover. Hafeez is determined not to put a foot wrong
clipped to midwicket to bring Hafeez back onto strike ...
tossed up, slapped over short midwicket! Just out of the reach of the fielder and as a consequence that will do!
clipped to midwicket to escape the strike. This could now end in a hurry...
smashed, on the up, straight over the ropes at long-off!
googly, but timed sweetly off the back foot through the covers
on the pads, flicked to midwicket
bouncer, ducked
so, another single, and Hafeez is handed the honour of hitting the winning run ...
not this time, defended out to point
guided down to third man, and that is the victory!
